input_text:
Job Title: Maintenance Technician

Location: Augusta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Maintenance Technician Position Overview:Our Maintenance Technicians hold key positions. They directly contribute to keeping our residents happy and satisfied by delivering on our promise to provide excellent maintenance service. This position is ideal for those who have up to 1 year’s experience in the operations and maintenance of assets (apartment homes and/or office buildings) and have proven abilities in meeting and exceeding expectations using individual talent and drive.How You'll Contribute to The Workplace:Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Monitor Turns, vacant units, and move-outsMaintain exterior appearance of the property to present good street appealCompletion of work ordersPerform routine preventative maintenance to ensure that building systems and physical condition of assets doesn’t deterioratePerform routine trash pick-up dailyRecord type and cost of maintenance or repair work neededCheck irrigation systems on a regular basisTrash compactor and pool maintenance during the seasonPlumbing, carpentry, drywall, insulating, roofing, pool maintenance, appliance installation and repairing buildings, floors or stairs,Basic electrical experienceFabricate and repair of appliances, etc.LandscapingWill participate in on-call rotationAll other duties as assignedHow We Reward & Support You:Competitive sign-on bonus!Providing personalized career growth opportunities through ongoing educational classes and industry certificationsOngoing hands-on training with HVAC, plumbing, electrical, fire safety & pool equipmentRewarding with competitive pay and benefits.A full benefits package: Retirement matching plan, health insurance package, life insurance planPersonal Time Off Plan"PMG Gives Back" Opportunities through philanthropic initiatives, such as Toys for Tots, food drives and more.Supervisory ResponsibilitiesThis job has no direct reportsQualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Education and/or ExperienceHigh school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Certificates, Licenses, RegistrationsCFC, CPO, HVAC Certifications (Recommended)Other QualificationsMust have own vehicle and toolsMust have a valid driver’s license and insurance

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Maintenance Technician
output_json.summary: Maintenance Technician Position Overview: Our Maintenance Technicians hold key positions. They directly contribute to keeping our residents happy and satisfied by delivering on our promise to provide excellent maintenance service.
job_responsibilities: Monitor Turns, vacant units, and move-outs
Maintain exterior appearance of the property to present good street appeal
Perform routine preventative maintenance to ensure that building systems and physical condition of assets doesn’t deteriorate
Record type and cost of maintenance or repair work needed
Check irrigation systems on a regular basis
Trash compactor and pool maintenance during the season
Plumbing, carpentry, drywall, insulating, roofing, pool maintenance, appliance installation and repairing buildings, floors or stairs
Fabricate and repair of appliances, etc.
benefits: Providing personalized career growth opportunities through ongoing educational classes and industry certifications
Ongoing hands-on training with HVAC, plumbing, electrical, fire safety & pool equipment
Rewarding with competitive pay and benefits
A full benefits package: Retirement matching plan, health insurance package, life insurance plan
"PMG Gives Back" Opportunities through philanthropic initiatives, such as Toys for Tots, food drives and more

other.content: Education and/or Experience: High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: CFC, CPO, HVAC Certifications (Recommended). Other Qualifications: Must have own vehicle and tools. Must have a valid driver’s license and insurance.
